abstract: A change to the tax credits proposed in the Senate version of the economic stimulus package would eliminate most or all of a proposed $1.6 billion windfall for Verizon.
snippet: A change to the tax credits proposed in the Senate version of the economic stimulus package would eliminate most or all of a proposed $1.6 billion windfall for Verizon.
lead_paragraph: UPDATE |10:18 PM: David Herszenhorn reports that the latest proposal by a group of moderate senators meant to cut the size of the stimulus package would reduce the spending on broadband by $1.5 billion. That would still leave $7.5 billion in broadband spending in the Senate bill, more than the $6 billion in the House version.

headline.main: Senate Scales Back Broadband Tax Breaks
